title: Quiz 2: Community Diagnosis & Strategy
description: Evaluates understanding of community diagnosis tools, the community strategy framework, surveys, and participatory methods.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of 'Community Diagnosis'?

options.text: To treat individual patients in a village setting
To define existing problems, determine resources, and set priorities for health action
To conduct a census of the population only
To diagnose communicable diseases in a hospital

questions.explanation: Community diagnosis aims to define problems, resources, and priorities for planning, implementing, and evaluating health action by and for the community.
questions.hint: Think about the community as the 'patient' rather than an individual.

questions.question: Match the type of Health Indicator with its specific example:

pairs.right: Infant Mortality Rate / Crude Death Rate

questions.explanation: Mortality relates to death; Morbidity relates to illness; Delivery relates to service availability; Nutritional relates to growth/diet status.
questions.hint: Connect 'Death' to Mortality and 'Sickness' to Morbidity.

questions.question: Order the stages of the Community Diagnosis implementation process:
questions.explanation: The process moves from Initiation -> Data Collection -> Diagnosis -> Dissemination.
questions.hint: You must start the project before collecting data, and diagnose before reporting.

questions.question: In the context of Participatory Rural Appraisal (PRA), ___BLANK___ is a method of linking different survey methods to crosscheck information.
questions.explanation: Triangulation is using combined approaches/methods to ensure reliability and validity by cross-checking data.
questions.hint: This geometric term implies using multiple points to verify a location or fact.

questions.question: Which of the following are principles of Participatory Rural Appraisal (PRA)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: A reversal of learning (learning from rural people)

questions.explanation: PRA principles include reversal of learning, rapid learning, seeking diversity, triangulation, and facilitation by local people. It opposes top-down approaches.
questions.hint: PRA focuses on the community's knowledge, not just the expert's.

questions.question: What is 'Selection Bias' or 'Unrepresentative Sample' in a survey?

options.text: When the survey sample does not accurately represent the population
When individuals are unwilling to participate
When respondents answer questions untruthfully to look good
When the questionnaire has grammatical errors

questions.explanation: Selection bias occurs when the sample chosen does not reflect the broader population, leading to skewed results.

questions.question: What is the overall goal of the Community Strategy in Kenya?
acceptedAnswers: Enhance community access to health care
questions.explanation: The goal is to enhance community access to health care to improve productivity, reduce poverty/hunger, and reduce child/maternal deaths (Level 1 service delivery).
questions.hint: It aims to bring health services closer to the people to improve overall well-being.

questions.question: According to the Community Strategy framework, 'Level 1' services refer to the District Hospital.
questions.explanation: Level 1 services refer to the Community level (Households, villages). District hospitals are higher levels (Level 4).
questions.hint: Level 1 is the foundation or base of the pyramid.

questions.question: Which document is described below?

richContent.content: A research instrument consisting of a series of questions and other prompts for the purpose of gathering information from respondents.

questions.explanation: A questionnaire is the specific tool used to ask questions and gather data in a survey.

questions.question: What are the roles of households in the Community Strategy? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Governance and management of health services

questions.explanation: Households are involved in promotion, prevention, governance, care seeking, and claiming rights. Clinical procedures like surgery are for professionals.
